description:
This course immerses students in the social, political, economic and cultural
context of the First Opium War between Britain and China from 1839 to
1842. This war, fought over the opium trade, is seen as a major turning point
in world history. The course will take a long view of the war and explore the long‐ and short‐term causes as well as the immediate and long‐term
consequences of the war.
title: The First Opium War, 1839‐42
